intro: Dracophyllum squarrosum, commonly known as the squarrose dracophyllum, is a shrub native to Australia and New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Dracophyllum squarrosum is adapted to harsh environments and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
